learning_outcomes.description: Understand and critique the multi-dimensional role of energy in achieving sustainable development goals.
Adopt a systems approach when examining energy access issues such as the energy trilemma.
Critically evaluate development paradigms and the contributions of the public and private sectors in achieving sustainable energy access for all.
Demonstrate an understanding appropriate technology for energy access projects.
Articulate the social and stakeholder impacts of energy proposals and management of social licence to operate.
Reflect on sustainability leadership and working in multi-disciplinary, professional teams.

assessments.assessment_title: Individual Project: Energy Trilemma Case Study
assessments.task_description:
National Case Study (Individual Project)

Strategy for improving a nation's Energy Trilemma Index

Using the World Energy Council Trilemma Index http://www.worldenergy.org/data/trilemma-index/ you will focus on one nation to become the focus of your case study. The main aim for your work is to propose to the nation's government an intervention that will help to move the nation towards a more positive trend on the Index (i.e. up the ladder and therefore closer to 1). The WEC national report will provide you with a starting point for your work. However, you are expected to research widely to discover more detailed information about the nation. This will include gathering information on current and expected energy demands, existing energy sources, current policy and regulatory framework. You are advised to use case studies from other nations, and academic articles, to help inform your approach.

Your submission for the Individual Project consists of:

1. Written Responses to key criteria, using systems diagrams

2. Presentation explainer on connections with SDGs
